item.title: What tyres will the teams and drivers have for the 2023 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix?
item.description: Pirelli have announced which tyres they will be bringing to the drivers and their teams for the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix - the final race of the 2023 season. F1’s official tyre supplier has revealed that the three softest compounds in their range will be used in Abu Dhabi as seen last time out in Las Vegas - with the teams able to call upon the C3 (hard tyre), C4 (medium tyre), and the C5 (softs).

item.title: AlphaTauri choose F2 star Ayumu Iwasa for end of season test alongside Ricciardo and Tsunoda
item.description: Red Bull junior and Honda-backed driver Ayumu Iwasa will get his first taste of Formula 1 machinery when he completes testing duties for AlphaTauri in the post-season test in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday. The Japanese racer is currently third in the F2 championship, having scored three wins, with one round to go this weekend. He’s 39 points adrift of championship leader Theo Pourchaire, and must take wins in both the Sprint and Feature races, plus pole and both fastest laps - with his French rival not scoring - to take the title.

Max Verstappen and Red Bull may have already won both titles but there is plenty on the line in Abu Dhabi. The battle for fourth in the drivers’ championship is set to go down to the wire with just 12 points separating Fernando Alonso, Carlos Sainz, Lando Norris, and Charles Leclerc.
